Trump’s endorsement," The New York Times reports.

title: Six more Republicans sued over Constitution’s ban on insurrectionists running for office: report

sentence: A group seeking to bar those it blames for the Jan. 6, 2021, riot at the U.S. Capitol from seeking further office helped file lawsuits Thursday against U.S. Reps. Andy Biggs and Paul Gosar, as well as state Rep. Mark Finchem.

title: Lawsuits aim to ban Andy Biggs, Paul Gosar and Mark Finchem from holding office

sentence: Free Speech For People filed lawsuits on behalf of voters in Arizona’s Maricopa County that challenge the eligibility for the office of GOP Reps. Paul Gosar and Andy Biggs, and state Rep. Mark Finchem.

title: Liberals push legal effort to block Republican ‘insurrectionists’ from the ballot

sentence: In a separate suit, Free Speech for People (FSFP), an organization formed in 2010, committed to getting money out of politics and securing and protecting the right of all citizens to vote – a right guaranteed by the 14th amendment – filed suit in Maricopa County against US Representatives Paul Gosar (R-AZ), Andy Biggs (R-AZ), and former GOP state Rep. Mark Finchem to prevent each of them from running for re-election.

sentence: The plaintiffs in the case, the group Free Speech for the People (more irony), are trying to use Section 3 of the 14th Amendment to the Constitution, which prohibits elected officials from engaging in an insurrection or rebellion to knock Rep. Paul Gosar (R-AZ), Rep. Andy Biggs (R-AZ) and state Rep. Mark Finchem (who’s running for Secretary of State) off the ballot in Arizona.
author: Nick Arama
title: Effort to Block GOP Reps From Running Because of Jan. 6 Goes Down to Withering Defeat

sentence: On Friday, however, an Arizona judge ruled against one of the latest rounds of lawsuits, this time from voting groups seeking to prevent Reps. Paul Gosar and Andy Biggs, both Republicans from Arizona, as well as State Rep. Mark Finchem, a fellow Republican from the state, from appearing on the ballot.
author: Rebecca Downs
title: Judge Dismisses Lawsuits Trying to Bar Reps. Paul Gosar, Andy Biggs from Running for Re-Election

sentence: The decision from Maricopa County Superior Court Judge Christopher Coury made public Friday means Reps. Paul Gosar and Andy Biggs and state Rep. Mark Finchem remain on the primary ballot barring a reversal by the state Supreme Court.

title: Arizona judge nixes suit that seeks to keep Trump backers off ballot

sentence: They filed a lawsuit to stop Reps Paul Gosar, Andy Biggs, and State House Rep Mark Finchem alleging that they participated in an “insurrection” stemming from the Jan 6 riot.
